item.title: Improper parking blocking access to disabled and public, 9th November
item.description:
I am writing to express my concern regarding persistent issues with improper parking in front of the disabled bay. This recurring problem consistently obstructs access for the public and, more importantly, for my disabled father. The current situation poses a significant barrier to essential services and accessibility for those who rely on this designated parking area. I have observed vehicles repeatedly disregarding the purpose and importance of this space. This creates considerable inconvenience and frustration for individuals with mobility challenges. I urge you to consider implementing measures to ensure this vital access remains clear. Addressing this issue would greatly improve the experience for all users. Bikes registration: BQM- ATH

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Corbyn Street, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked cars on double yellow lines, 9th November
item.description:
Every Sunday there are cars parked illegally on double yellow lines immediately outside WhiteOak leisure centre. They block a lane of traffic and turn Hilda May Avenue in to a single lane road. They council will make a fortune issuing tickets on a Sunday morning from 10:00 to 12:00
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hilda May Avenue, White Oak, Swanley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Playground is full of smashed beer glasses, especially around slides and swings, 9th November
item.description:
Report of Broken Glasses in Playground I am writing to bring to your attention the presence of broken glass in the playground located at West Norwood park. This poses a significant safety hazard for children and families using the facility. I recommend that immediate action be taken to remove the hazardous materials and ensure the area is safe for all visitors. Regular inspections may also be beneficial to prevent similar issues in the future. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, Dimi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salters Hill, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
